attributes.action: Review the current laws of incitement to hatred.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We the undersigned wish to ask the government, under the Prime Minister, to 
carry out a review into the laws against incitement to hatred.  We have laws 
protecting people on the grounds of religion, race, colour and sexual 
orientation, but as yet there is nothing to protect individuals outside of 
these parameters.  We wish to seek redress, and see that no individual 
should suffer from websites set up to incite hatred against them.  An 
example is the late Jade Goody, who was vilified on the internet till her 
dying day.  Other example are the sports commentator Jane Tomlinson, and the 
parents of abducted Madeleine McCann.  Even an eleven year old girl 
suffering from leukemia, who was keeping her own little blog about her daily 
life, all these people have suffered from having websites set up to incite 
hatred against them.  We feel the law needs to be tightened, and websites 
such as these should be banned, and membership of such sites made illegal 
forthwith.
